objects.name: PAP
objects.description: This defines PAP as a STIX extension

objects.name: graphalgo
objects.description: A sophisticated recruitment-themed campaign targeting JavaScript and Python developers. Attackers pose as a blockchain company named 'Veltrix Capital' to trick candidates into running malicious npm and PyPI packages (e.g., bigmathutils) as part of technical tests.

objects.content:
Sector: Technology, Cryptocurrency, Software Development

Modus operandi:
Use of fake job interviews on LinkedIn/Reddit, hosting malicious code on GitHub, and pushing delayed malicious updates to trusted packages to deliver a Remote Access Trojan (RAT).

objects.name: Notepad++ Hijack
objects.description: A state-sponsored supply chain attack where the official Notepad++ hosting infrastructure was compromised to deliver malicious updates to specific targets in Southeast Asia.

objects.content:
Sector: Government, Telecommunications, Critical Infrastructure

Modus operandi:
Adversary-in-the-Middle (AitM) traffic hijacking on the hosting provider to selectively serve the Chrysalis backdoor or Cobalt Strike via DLL side-loading and Lua script injection.

objects.name: CVE-2026-1490
objects.description:
Unauthenticated authorization bypass in 'checkWithoutToken' function via Reverse DNS (PTR) spoofing, allowing arbitrary plugin installation and RCE.

Affected product: Anti-Spam by CleanTalk

Affected vendor: CleanTalk

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:cleantalk:cleantalk:*:*:*:*:*:wordpress:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-1358
objects.description:
Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in compressor management systems, allowing unauthenticated RCE with maximum privileges.

Affected product: Airleader Master

Affected vendor: Airleader

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:airleader:airleader_master:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-21533
objects.description:
Windows Remote Desktop Services elevation of privilege; zero-day exploited in the wild.

Affected product: Remote Desktop Services

Affected vendor: Microsoft

CPE: cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: Breach: Flickr
objects.description:
Data breach via a third-party email service provider. Exposed data includes usernames, emails, IP addresses, and geolocation data for up to 35 million monthly users.

Sector: Social Media / Photography

objects.name: Mercer Advisors, Canada Goose, University of Pennsylvania
Breach: Mercer Advisors, Canada Goose, University of Pennsylvania
objects.description:
Multiple high-profile data thefts and extortion attempts. Mercer Advisors (5M+ records), Canada Goose (600k records), and UPenn (1.2M records) have been targeted with final warnings before public leaks.

Sector: Finance, Retail, Education

objects.content:
Sector: Technology & Human Resources

Theme: State-sponsored Economic Espionage

North Korean and Chinese-linked APTs (Lazarus, Lotus Blossom, UNC3886) are intensifying operations against software developers and telecommunication providers in Singapore and Southeast Asia to facilitate long-term intelligence gathering and financial theft.

Tags: North Korea, China, Southeast Asia, Espionage

objects.name: ClickFix DNS-based PowerShell Delivery
objects.description:
A new ClickFix variant where victims are tricked into running an nslookup command against an attacker-controlled DNS server to retrieve and execute a PowerShell payload.

Analysis:
This evolution of ClickFix marks the first use of DNS as a payload delivery channel in this specific social engineering campaign. By using nslookup, attackers evade many URL-based security filters.

Recommendations:
- Block unauthorized DNS queries to non-corporate DNS servers at the firewall level.
- Educate users to never execute commands provided by unsolicited 'support' or 'fix' pages.

objects.name: Lumma Stealer & Ninja Browser Google Groups Campaign
objects.description:
Massive distribution of Lumma Stealer and Ninja Browser via thousands of weaponized Google Groups. Payloads are padded with null bytes (950MB) to evade AV scanning.

Analysis:
Attackers are abusing the trust associated with Google's ecosystem (Groups, Docs, Drive) to bypass legacy reputation-based filters.

Recommendations:
- Implement file-size limits for real-time AV scanning and restrict execution of archives exceeding 500MB from web sources.

objects.name: Posteo Phishing Campaign
objects.description:
Active phishing site hosted on Weebly targeting Posteo mail users.

Analysis:
Standard credential harvesting campaign using free hosting providers to lower costs and evade static detection.

Recommendations:
- Blacklist the specific Weebly subdomain in secure web gateways.

objects.content: The threat landscape for February 2026 is marked by a significant escalation in supply chain attacks and highly creative social engineering. State-sponsored actors like Lazarus and Lotus Blossom are moving beyond simple malware delivery, instead compromising official software distribution infrastructures (Notepad++) and weaponizing developer ecosystems (npm/PyPI). Simultaneously, the 'ClickFix' technique has evolved to abuse core network protocols like DNS (nslookup) and browser functionality (JavaScript injection), bypassing traditional endpoint security. The massive exploitation of industrial systems (IoT/OT) via critical vulnerabilities with no immediate patches (ZLAN, Milvus) highlights a persistent risk to critical infrastructure.
